page.title: 10Visit to farm near Tiverton
page.content: A group went to interview a farmer's wife at Mogridge Farm on Seven Crosses Hill. This is shown on Photograph B. Mrs Jarrett gave some information about the surrounding farms. She said that some were mixed involving Beef and Sheep. Others concentrated on rearing pigs. Most had some Dairy produce but new EEC quotas were making it hard to get a fair profit from this. She said she could not give us a land price for the whole area as the land differed so much from place to place. On average she guessed that it sold for about 2,000 pounds per acre. This was too much for small farmers to pay.
